arm_group.description: Multimedia Connect and the Multimedia facilitator training curriculum with a 4-day, face-to-face structured orientation and training for implementation, and planned, investigative team initiated telephone consultations with CBO staff to provide technical assistance at 2 and 4 months following the training workshop;

The original, manualized version of Connect (CDC DEBI)and manualized facilitator training curriculum with a 4-day, face-to-face structured orientation and training for implementation, and planned, investigative team initiated telephone consultation with CBO staff to provide technical assistance at 2 and 4 months following the training workshop.

brief_summary.textblock:
This RCT will randomly assign 40 of the CBOs to receive the Multimedia intervention and
      training package (Multimedia)and the other 40 to receive the original, manualized Connect
      intervention and training package (Traditional). The technology transfer process involves
      all agencies receiving four days of training and two planned technical assistance conference
      calls, by study investigative staff, in the first four months following training. Telephone
      assessments completed by up to 6 staff at each agency will measure primary outcomes,
      mediating, moderating and process measure variables at baseline, 6, 12 and 18 months
      post-technology transfer. The primary outcome of the study is adoptions of the Connect
      intervention. The unit of analysis is the CBO.

clinical_study.brief_title: Using Multimedia Technologies to Disseminate an HIV Prevention

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        To be eligible for the study, CBOs must have reported that they

          -  had 501c3 status;

          -  provided at least a minimum level of direct contact HIV prevention services to
             clientele; and

          -  that their target population for services included heterosexual men and women.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

clinical_study.official_title: Using Multimedia Technologies to Disseminate an HIV Prevention Program for Couples

primary_outcome.measure: The mean number of Connect sessions per client/couple implemented by participating staff (at each agency) in the prior 6 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: To test whether key variables mediate adoption outcomes (e.g. staff attitudes and opinions towards programming and technology).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
